docs.snippet: Indications that the fall of Gen. Juan D. Person as dictator of Argentina was imminent were reported to The New York Times from Buenos Aires yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Indications that the fall of Gen. Juan D. Person as dictator of Argentina was imminent were reported to The New York Times from Buenos Aires yesterday.
docs.abstract: E A Morrow (NY Times) repts indications of Peron's imminent removal as dictator, phone call from BA supplementing regular dispatch; repts his resignation was expected 2 days ago; sees Lucero acting as Govt spokesman and apparently top leader; repts Army-Navy confs on setting up junta probably headed by Lucero; sees Peron figurehead in new Govt while keeping title of Pres; holds repts from Uruguay that Peron is prisoner of mil not 'really true'; sees fleet, still unacctd for, potential threat to any new Govt which does not include Navy

headline.main: PERON'S REMOVAL AS DICTATOR SEEN; JUNTA MAY RULE; President Expected to Stay as Figurehead, With Gen. Lucero Holding Power

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 20 -- An Argentine Congressman said here today that President Peron suspected Gen. Franklin Lucero had ambitions for power. He said President Peron had hurried back last year from a motion-picture festival because of rumors...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 20 -- An Argentine Congressman said here today that President Peron suspected Gen. Franklin Lucero had ambitions for power. He said President Peron had hurried back last year from a motion-picture festival because of rumors that General Lucero was organizing a plot.

byline.original: By SAM POPE BREWERSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 21 -- The Uruguayants are following Argentine developments anxiously. These happenings have a direct bearing on Uruguay's welfare.
